results.title: Kevin is fine
results.creator_credit: The Film House and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: A woman living in an isolated farm house in North Western Victoria believes her child has a learning deficiency. Her own fears and the attitude of her husband have prevented her from seeking help. Covers a series of events which lead her to take action. Cast: Nancy Black, Ross Williams.

results.title: Kevin Alec
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children of Canada”.
In the mountainous country near Lillooet, British Columbia, eleven-year-old Kevin Alec of the Fountain Indian Reserve learns to make fishnets with his grandfather, and skin and tan hides with his aunt. He goes fishing with his grandmother and horseback riding with his brother. Life is full of wonderful things to do and to learn. Will Kevin eventually abandon his Indian way of life or will it be a source of continuing enrichment?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Kes
results.creator_credit: Tony Garnett, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Ken Loach
results.brief_description: This is one of Ken Loach’s earliest films in which he already shows his talent for portraying the starkness of working class life in an unaffected style with unknown actors. Billy (David Bradley), is the son of a northern miner whose expectations lead no further than following his father into the pits when he reaches manhood. Billy is an ordinary child, doing the morning paper round, reading ‘Desperate Dan’ on the way to school and playing football. Everything changes when he finds Kes, an injured Kestrel, which he nurses back to health. Kes becomes Billy’s best friend and his obsession with learning the ways of the hawk finally give him a purpose and his once empty landscape assumes new dimensions. Tragedy awaits however, as Billy’s older brother, who fancies birds of a different kind and horses, provides a traumatic end to the relationship.

results.title: Kerry
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Kerry is a fifteen year old girl who leaves home and lives with her boyfriend. She becomes pregnant and returns to her family. The film considers some of the effects that the pregnancy and the decision to keep the baby have on Kerry’s relationship with her family and her boyfriend.

results.title: Kerouac's road: a Franco-American odyssey
results.creator_credit: Eric Michel, ONF | NFB and Hermenegilde Chiasson
results.brief_description: Jack Kerouac, the novelist who revolutionised the form of American fiction and journalism, was born to a family of French-Canadians in exile and did not begin to understand English until he was six. Alienation, a quest for transcendence and the need to discover a new language would ultimately define his art. Through dramatised excerpts, period footage and candid interviews, this film shows how Kerouac’s restless seeking as a literary bohemian embodied a larger Franco-American pattern of emigration and displacement.

results.title: Kermit's swamp years [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ritamarie Peruggi, Jim Henson Company and David Gumpel
results.brief_description: Travelling down the road to his traditional home at “the swamp,” Kermit (Steve Whitmire) reflects on the good old days aged 12 with pals Croaker and Goggles as they mucked about in the swamp attempting to prove their braveness and pondering a life beyond theirs. When they actually make it to the end of the world as they know it and the road that leads to civilisation, the adventure of a lifetime begins as a pet-store owner who supplies frogs for a science class in which amphibians will be dissected, kidnaps Goggles. Kermit and Croaker, along with a shaggy dog who has just saved their lives, head into the city in search of their friend. It’s also during this time that Kermit discovers that he wants to be in the movies. Features a range of new Muppet characters that do not appear in “The Muppet show”. Features live and Muppet action. Cast also includes Bill Barretta, Dave Goelz and Joey Mazzarino.

results.title: Kerala: land of lagoons
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and Mohan Wadhwani
results.brief_description: Surveys the scenic beauty of the southwestern Indian state of Kerala and the colorful festivities observed by its people. Includes scene of the celebration of Onam, an old festival of Kerala, a boat race on Periyar Lake, a temple festival, and the famous dance-drama Kathakali.

results.title: Kerala
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and T.A. Abraham
results.brief_description: A picture of Kerala State in south-west India. A flat fertile land with many waterways supporting a dense population; many crops including spices, for which the district was known to the Arabs and Phoenicians; Vasco da Gama and the history of Kerala; the Byzantine influence in the city of Trivandrum; paintings and sculptures in the museum and much more including the life and customs of the people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and T.A. Abraham

results.title: Keppoch Estate
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Keppoch Estate, to the north of Coonawarra, the film discusses the development of a new wine area by Thomas Hardy and Sons, a family tradition in fine wine making since 1853.
